creator: david@brusowankin.net
text:
documentation relating to apache 2.0 is in french !!!

http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/new_features_2_0.html
http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/
http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/upgrading.html

creator: thom@planetarytramp.net
text:
This is a problem with your browser configuration, not with the apache site.
Apache serves a file in a specific language based on what your browser asks for.
I can't help with configuring Explorer since I don't use windows, the microsoft
knowledge base will probably help though.
Hint for MSIE: Tools -> Options -> Languages
creator: slive@apache.org
erik@codefaktor.de
text:
The documentation for Apache 2.0 is available in different languages. The
HTML-documents are negotiated according to your browser-settings. Please correct
your language configuration in your browser or try
http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/new_features_2_0.html.en to 'manually' reach
the English documentation.

Thanks for using Apache 2.0!

creator: david@brusowankin.net
text: I am using Mozilla 1.2b. Perhaps I should file a bug report with mozilla, hmmmm ?

Possibly, but first check in:
Preferences -> Navigator -> Languages and see what languages are set and in what
order.
(This is where it is on mozilla in linux, anyway)
creator: thom@planetarytramp.net
